issues.description: The problem statement text on line 49 specifies that the `addGuestStudents` method should take a `String` parameter (`addGuestStudents(String)`). However, the UML diagram on line 73 of the same problem statement and the solution repository's implementation on line 90 of `Lecture.java` both indicate that the method should take an `int` parameter (`addGuestStudents(int)`). This inconsistency can confuse students about the correct method signature to implement.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the problem statement text on line 49 to specify `addGuestStudents(int)` to align with the UML diagram and the intended solution. For example, change 'Implement a `addGuestStudents(String)` method' to 'Implement a `addGuestStudents(int)` method'.

issues.description: The problem statement text describes the `addGuestStudents` method as taking a `String` parameter, while the UML diagram (also part of the problem statement) and the solution repository correctly show it taking an `int` parameter. This creates a direct contradiction for students trying to implement the method, as they will be unsure which parameter type to use.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the problem statement text on line 50 to specify `addGuestStudents(int)` instead of `addGuestStudents(String)` to align with the UML diagram and the intended solution.
